dialogues.text: as Helen turns and hurries across the sidewalk to the hou In the entrance she turns and waves to Tom. He waves back and drives off slowly. Helen lets herself in with her key

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Detective is putting on his hat and preparing to leav with Klaatu as Helen enters. There is a moment of awkward and confusion as she glances, puzzled, at the Detective.  Bobby runs to her and greets her excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, darling. (she kisses Bobby,  then turns  questioningly to  Klaatu and the  Detective) Good evening, Mr. Carpenter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaatu is uneasy but tries not to show it as he smiles in greeting and introduces the Detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Benson -- this is Mr. Brady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Impressively) Mr. Brady's a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen glances quickly at the Detective, then at Klaatu,  surprised and troubled. She turns to Bobby to cover her  confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bobby) Did you have a nice day, dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enthusiastically) Boy, we had a swell time. Didn't we,  Mr. Carpenter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We certainly did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We went to the movies -- and we had  ice cream cones -- and we went to  see Daddy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moved and grateful,  she's uneasy and  concerned as she  turns to Klaatu) I don't know how to thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I enjoyed every minute of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with quiet insistence) We better get goin', Mr. Carpenter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Klaatu nods and prepares to follow him, Bobby speaks t Klaatu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, gee -- we didn't finish our story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll finish it tomorrow... Goodnight,  Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaatu and the Detective nod to Helen and they go out. He watches the door close with real concern, wondering why t police want Klaatu and hoping he hasn't done anything wro Still disturbed, she turns to lead Bobby upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Bobby. Time to go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he followers her,  then hesitates) Mom -- why does Mr. Carpenter have  to go down to the police station?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- I don't know, dear... Perhaps  there's some mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This satisfies him for the moment -- even though it doesn satisfy Helen. He is climbing the stairs beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sure had fun today. We saw the  space ship and we went to see  Professor Barnhardt -- and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flashing him a  puzzled, incredulous  look) Professor Barnhardt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost ignoring the  interruption) Yeah, sure. Mom, do I have to go to  school tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, gee, Mom -- I had plans to play  with Mr. Carpenter.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The place is crowded and there is a feeling of feverish b well-ordered activity. Unidentified people who have been  picked up in the search for the space man are being scree by the police. They are all men -- all between forty and  sixty years old -- and they are from all walks of life. A series of desks have been arranged in a row, with signs o them reading IDENTIFICATION. At each desk is a team of co and before each desk is a line of men waiting to be scree At the far end of the room Klaatu can be seen at the desk a Police Lieutenant, with the detective who picked him up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting over the shoulders of two cops at one of the des toward the line of people they are screening. A nondescri middle-aged vagrant stands before the desk as one of the  cops flips through a card file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the cop beside  him) B.M. Alberts -- no prior arrests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the vagrant) No identification? (the man shakes his  head dully) Send him over to G-2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man is taken out of the line as CAMERA MOVES ON to th next desk, with another pair of cops and another line. A  rather distinguished-looking business man is placing a sh of identification cards and papers on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife just arrived with my  identification.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the cops at the desk glances over the papers and n to the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be all, Mr. Baxter. Sorry to  bother you... Next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES ON to a third desk where a small, rat-faced is standing uneasily before the two cops, one of whom is  flipping through a card file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cappo, John C? (the man nods) Two priors -- one for petty theft --  one for shoplifting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving the man away) Okay, Jonny -- you can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a nervous grin) Sometimes a record comes in handy. (and he moves off)

dialogues.speaker: AT LIEUTENANT'S DESK
dialogues.text: A Detective Lieutenant in plain clothes is questioning Kl who stands beside the Detective who brought him in. The  Lieutenant is a rugged but dignified man about fifty,  intelligent and businesslike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Professor's secretary says she  found you in Barnhardt's room, making  marks on his blackboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was only trying to be helpful. He  was having difficulty with a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lieutenant exchanges a look with the Detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sardonically) Oh, I see. He was having trouble and  you were helping him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleasantly) That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly sharp and  accusing) I suppose you know that Barnhardt  does a lot of secret work for the  Army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this case the secret wouldn't be  worth much. He doesn't know the answer  himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growing impatient) But I suppose you know the answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a deprecating  shrug) It's really quite simple... The three- body problem, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lieutenant shifts in his chair, annoyed that he has t deal with this madman. He glances at a report on his desk trying to control his impatience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name's Carpenter -- that right? (Klaatu nods) Any identification, Mr. Carpenter?  Driver's license -- social security  number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I'm afraid not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how do I know who you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (secretly amused) You don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lieutenant is turning away in exasperation as a unifo cop comes into the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Lieutenant -- (pointing offscene) The Doc says this man needs treatment  right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man about forty-five, bloodied and badly beaten, is bei supported and half-carried by two policemen. A police doc is guiding them to a doorway, near which is a sign INFIRM The man is almost unconscious, incapable even of holding his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some fella caught him lookin' in a  window and figured he was the space  man. The whole neighborhood went  crazy and they ganged up on him.  Would have killed him if we hadn't  come along... Turns out he was just  a prowler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lieutenant grimaces his disgust and impatience with m violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- book him and get him fixed  up. (the cops nods and  goes, and the  Lieutenant growls as  he turns back to  Klaatu and the  Detective) Looks like everybody's goin' nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appalled by what he  has seen and heard) They would have killed this man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gruffly) People get hysterical enough, they  do anything. (impatiently) Look, Mr. Carpenter -- if you can't  identify yourself, I got to send you  over to the Army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pretending impatience,  but actually growing  concerned) How long will that take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can tell right away. They've  got a couple of doctors who saw this  man in the hospital. (to the Detective) Take him over to G2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really concerned now, Klaatu tries to find a way out. He  attempts an authoritative air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very important, Lieutenant,  that I see Professor Barnhardt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Mr. Carpenter--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaking off the Detective's hand, Klaatu speaks to the  Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I suggest that you call the  Professor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all patience gone) Get going, will you, Brady -- before  I get mad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Detective takes Klaatu's arm and leads him toward the door. As they go they pass a Military Police Captain, who makes his way straight to the Lieutenant's desk.

dialogues.speaker: KLAATU AND DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: as they come out of the station. Klaatu hesitates a momen looks around. His face reveals nothing, but he seems to b momentarily considering the idea of making a break. The  Detective, sensitive to such a possibility, hooks his arm under Klaatu's and nods his head toward the sidewalk in s command. Klaatu allows himself to be led off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the Detective leads Klaatu across the sidewalk to the  curb, where a police car is standing. Parked just behind is an Army staff car.

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE TO POLICE STATION
dialogues.text: as the M.P. Captain appears in the entrance, accompanied the Police Lieutenant. They see Klaatu and the Detective  approaching the police car and hurry out of scene after t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Detective) Wait a minute, Brady-- (indicating orders in  his hand) The Captain here's got orders from  General Cutler to take this man over  to Professor Barnhardt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Klaatu firmly but  respectfully) Will you come with me, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Klaatu gets out of the police car and the Captain esco him toward the staff car. Passing the Lieutenant, Klaatu  speaks with a polite smile, a smile that might be one of  mild triumph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to trouble you, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lieutenant reacts with impatient exasperation as the  Captain holds the staff car door open for Klaatu, who ste into the Army vehicle, as we--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the M.P. Captain and Klaatu enter the front door, whic is held open for then by Hilda. She gestures them toward half-open door of Barnhardt's study, where Barnhardt can seen puzzling over the problem on the blackboard. The Cap knocks on the open door to attract his attention and ente with Klaatu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnhardt turns from his deep preoccupation at the blackb chalk in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the man you wanted to see,  Professor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studying Klaatu  curiously) Thank you, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wait outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps out into the hall, closing the door. Barnhardt  continues to study Klaatu for a moment, then points to th notations he made on the blackboard. There is a controlle but anxious excitement in Barnhardt's attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wrote this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding easily) It was a clumsy way to introduce  myself -- but I understand you're a  difficult man to see. (glancing at the  blackboard  reproachfully) I thought you'd have the solution by  this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. That's why I wanted to see  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaatu glances at the work Barnhardt has been doing on th board. Then he points to one of the expressions in an  equation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you have to do now is substitute  this expression-- (pointing to a specific  place) --at this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impressed and interested, Barnhardt tugs at his chin as h studies and weighs the results.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly, thoughtfully) Yes -- that will reproduce the first- order terms. But what about the effect  of the other terms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost negligible... With variation  of parameters, this is the answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you be so sure? Have you  tested this theory?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a slight smile) I find it works well enough to get  me from one planet to another. (Barnhardt stares at  him blankly) I understand you've called a meeting  to study our space ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As though unsure of what he's heard)  Yes -- yes, I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Klaatu. (noting that  Barnhardt's expression  is changing from  amazement to  incredulity) I spent two days at your Walter Reed  Hospital. Room 309. My doctor's name  was Major White -- and I had a very  attractive nurse called Ruth, who's  getting married next Wednesday. (Klaatu waits for  this to sink in,  then speaks with  quiet authority) If you are not interested -- or if  you intend to turn me over to your  Army -- we needn't waste any more  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnhardt hesitates for a long, thoughtful moment. Then h goes to the door, opens it and speaks to the Captain outs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Captain, his  voice a little  unsteady) You can go now, Captain. Please thank  General Cutler and tell him -- tell  him that I know this gentleman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnhardt closes the door and turns to find Klaatu watchi him with a faint smile. Barnhardt sinks into a chair, try to adjust his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly) You have faith, Professor Barnhardt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't faith that makes good  science, Mr. Klaatu. Its curiosity. (unable to conceal  his interest) Sit down, please. I have several  thousand questions to ask you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring the  invitation) I would like to explain something of  my mission here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my first question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with some bitterness) It was my intention to discuss this  officially -- with all the nations  of the Earth -- but I was not allowed  the Opportunity. I have come to  realize since that your mutual fears  and suspicions are merely the normal  reactions of a primitive society. (gathering his thoughts) We know from scientific observation  that you have discovered a rudimentary  kind of atomic energy. We also know  that you are experimenting with  rockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- that is true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the hands of a mature civilization,  these would not be considered weapons  of aggression. But in the hands of  your people-- (he shrugs and shakes  his head) We've observed your aggressive  tendencies, and we don't trust you  with such power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled) If you mean that you are afraid of  us--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with cool impressive  emphasis) We want to be sure you don't make --  let us say -- an unfortunate mistake.  We know the potentiality of these  developments and we are disturbed to  find them in the hands of children...  You see, we've had atomic energy for  five thousand of your years. (indicating the  telephone) We discarded instruments like this  many centuries ago. (he paces thoughtfully) So long as you were limited to  fighting among yourselves -- with  your primitive tanks and planes --  we were unconcerned. But soon you  will apply atomic energy to space  ships -- and then you become a threat  to the peace and security of other  planets. That, of course, we cannot  tolerate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoughtful and  impressed) These other planets -- do they have  peace and security?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had our atomic wars -- thousands  of years ago. (he smiles wryly) After that we fought with bows and  arrows. Then, slowly, we learned  that fighting is no solution -- that  aggression leads to chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with deep conviction) We scientists understand this. Even  we primitive scientists. (Straightforwardly) What exactly is the nature of your  mission, Mr. Klaatu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came here to warn you that, by  threatening danger, your planet faces  danger -- very grave danger. I am  prepared, however, to offer a  solution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you care to be more specific?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evenly) What I have to say must be said to  all concerned. (with a suggestion of  deference to Barnhardt) It is too important to be entrusted  to any individual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnhardt is forced reluctantly to accept Klaatu's refusa to go any further. After a moment's thought, he speaks  seriously, but with a twinkle in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gather that your efforts on the  official level were not entirely  successful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sternly, as this  unpleasant episode  is recalled) I come to you as a last resort --  and I confess that my patience is  wearing thin. (with Jovian annoyance) Must I take drastic action in order  to get a hearing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uneasily) What -- what sort of action do you  mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violent action -- since that seems  to be the only thing you people  understand. (quietly) Leveling the island of Manhattan,  perhaps -- or dropping the Rock of  Gibraltar into the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnhardt stands staring at him for a moment, passes his  hand across his brow. Then, as Klaatu watches, Barnhardt  paces the floor, trying to digest what he has heard. Afte moment, he turns to Klaatu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you be willing to meet with  the group of scientists I am calling  together?. Perhaps you could explain  your mission to them, and they in  turn could present it to their various  peoples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly, evenly) That's what I came to see you about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnhardt flings him a glance, then looks momentarily  sheepish. But his own eagerness carries him on. He paces floor thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is not enough to have men of  science. We scientists are too easily  ignored -- or misunderstood. We must  get important men from every field.  Educators -- philosophers -- church  leaders -- men of vision and  imagination -- the finest minds in  the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I leave that in your hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd have no objection to revealing  yourself at this meeting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your personal safety in  the meantime? What about the Army --  and the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Carpenter and I'm a very  earthy character living in a  respectable boarding house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling, but a little  concerned) I'm afraid I can't offer you any  real protection. I have no influence  in cases of inter-planetary  conspiracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure I'll be quite safe until  the meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he suddenly pauses,  thoughtfully) One thing, Mr. Klaatu. Suppose this  group should reject your proposals.  What is the alternative?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a sense of quiet,  inescapable power) I'm afraid you have no alternative.  In such, a case the planet Earth  would have to be-- (he looks for the  right word) --eliminated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The implications of this statement leave Barnhardt speech his keen mind reeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such power exists?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assure you such power exists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnhardt stands silent for a moment, trying to collect h shattered thoughts. Klaatu watches him as he starts pacin again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people who came to the meeting  must be made to realize this. They  must understand what is at stake. (after a thoughtful  moment, he looks up) You mentioned a demonstration of  force--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would such, a demonstration be  possible before the meeting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something that would dramatize for  them and for their people the  seriousness of the situation.  Something that would affect the entire  planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a nod) That can easily be arranged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened by his  easy assumption of  infinite power) I wouldn't want you to harm anybody --  or destroy anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (easily) Why don't you leave it to me? I'll  think of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a nervous half- smile) Maybe a little demonstration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking about it) Something dramatic -- but not  destructive. (intellectually amused) It's quite an interesting problem. (Barnhardt nods vaguely) Would day after tomorrow be all right?  Say about noon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaatu's bland manner leaves Barnhardt shaken, almost wis he'd never started this business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is about 3:30 the following evening. Helen is sitting a chair leafing through a magazine. She is dressed to go  out. A corner of the dining room can be seen, where Mr. a Mrs. Barley are playing cards with Mr. Krull. Mrs. Crocke the landlady, enters from the hall on her way to the dini room and notices Helen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going out, dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm waiting for Tom to pick me  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a shudder) Personally, I won't go out after  dark these days. (with an attempt at  slyness) But then -- I'm not courting, am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to go on into the dining room and as she does s almost bumps into Klaatu who is coming out, having been  kibitzing the card game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoroughly startled) Oh -- Mr. Carpenter--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaatu steps aside as she hurries nervously into the dini room. He turns, puzzled, to find Helen watching with a sl smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone seems so-- (he shakes his hands  to indicate  nervousness)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jittery is the word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen watches him, a little uneasy in his presence. She i fond of him, and she can't help being curious and concern about his brush with the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a contemplative  smile) Bobby's the only person I know who  isn't -- Jittery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has his homework to keep him  occupied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fondly, sincerely) He's a fine boy, Mrs. Benson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naturally I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warm and friendly and intelligent-- (thoughtfully) You know -- he's the only real friend  I've made since I've been here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen is deeply moved by Klaatu's affection for the boy, tried to dismiss her curiosity about him, but she can't. decides to face it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitantly and with  some difficulty) Mr. Carpenter -- this is none of my  business, but -- why did that  detective come here last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with easy frankness) Oh -- they just wanted to ask me a  few questions. Bobby and I tried to  see Professor Barnhardt in the  afternoon, but he wasn't in.  Apparently they thought I was looking  for secrets of some kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen has reacted in puzzlement at this second mention of Barnhardt. They are interrupted by the ringing of the  doorbell. Helen goes to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Helen opens the front door to admit Tom. He appears  impatient, anxious to get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will be in just a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little annoyed  that she hasn't her  coat on, he consults  his watch) The picture starts at eight-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in explanation) I was talking to Mr. Carpenter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lightly, but with  real sarcasm  underneath) I hope Mr. Carpenter won't think I'm  intruding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen tries to shush him, to indicate Klaatu is in the ne room, when Klaatu appears in the doorway. He must have he Tom's remark, and there is an awkward moment. Klaatu is  completely unperturbed, but Helen is embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. I was just going up to my  room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (guiltily) Goodnight, Mr. Carpenter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaatu stops and turns to face them pleasantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good time -- both of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes on up the stairs. Helen steers Tom toward the liv room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you wait in here while I  get my things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they enter from the hall, Helen turns to Tom reproachf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Oh, Tom, that was awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (momentary apologetic) I'm sorry. I guess I'm just tired of  hearing about Mr. Carpenter. (Helen shushes him) I don't like the way he's attached  himself to you and Bobby. After all,  what do you know about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This touches on Helen's own private doubts, and she canno answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go get my things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns quickly and goes into the hall and hurries up t stairs. Tom looks after her, dismissing the matter with a shake of the head and a philosophical sigh. Of such stuff are women made.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Helen reaches the top of the stairs, crosses to her room grabs a coat off the bed. She's putting it on as she move down the hall to Bobby's room, the door of which is open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is at a table doing his homework and Klaatu has jus finished explaining an arithmetic problem to him, as Hele enters, still putting on her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (about to leave) All you have to remember is, first  find the common denominator -- then  subtract.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mr. Carpenter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Helen, pleasantly) I'll say goodnight again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen is embarrassed. She would like to apologize for the awkwardness downstairs but she doesn't quite know how to about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Carpenter, I-- (it's too complicated;  she can't do it) Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a warm smile of  complete understanding  and appreciation) Goodnight, my dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and goes out, closing the door. A little distrac Helen turns to Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to bed, darling. You can finish  that in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen watches as he starts to put away his work. She want to tell him something, but finds it difficult to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitantly, almost  guiltily) Bobby -- I think it would be better  if we didn't see quite so much of  Mr. Carpenter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked, and  bewildered) Gee, why, Mom? He's my best friend...  And he's awful good in arithmetic.  He even helps Professor Barnhardt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you and Mr. Carpenter really go  to see Professor Barnhardt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure we did! He wasn't there but we  went to see him. And Mr. Carpenter  showed him how to do his arithmetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen is surprised to get this corroboration for Klaatu's story. Sensing his mother's uneasiness, the boy looks for something intriguing -- some deep, dark secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrewdly) Mom -- is there something wrong with  Mr. Carpenter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean -- on account of that policeman  last night. (his eyes light up  hopefully) You think he's a bank robber, maybe?  Or a gangster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, dear, of course not. He's a very  nice man. I Just think he might prefer  to be left alone. Now you get to bed  and forget about it. (she kisses him) 'Night, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a reassuring smile, she starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight. (stopping her in the  doorway, his  imaginative suspicions  mounting) Hey Mom -- why would he want to be  alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not wanting to go into this any further, Helen blows him kiss and backs out, closing the door. Bobby stands thinki for a moment, his mind still speculating on all sorts of  wonderful possibilities. Still preoccupied, he drifts ove to his bed and sits down to take of his shoes. He drops t first one to the floor and is starting on the other, when there is a light rap on his door. The door opens and Klaa appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby -- have you a flashlight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised by his  appearance and his  request) Yeah -- sure. (he goes to a drawer  and gets a large  hand flashlight) It's a real Boy Scout flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby hands him the light, studying his face with eager  curiosity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want it for, Mr.  Carpenter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evasively) Why -- the light in my room went  out. (cutting off further  questions) Thank you, Bobby. Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaatu goes out, closing the door behind him. Bobby hesit a moment, puzzled and curious. Then he goes over to the d flips off the lights, and slowly, noiselessly opens the d a crack so he can peer out into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shooting down the hall through the crack in Bobby's door. Klaatu's door is ajar and through it the lights in his ro can be seen burning brightly. Klaatu goes to his door, re in and flips off the lights and closes the door. He then  scans the hall in both directions. Satisfied he isn't see he moves surreptitiously down the hall toward the stairs, still carrying the flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: as he closes his door carefully, an expression of intense excitement on his face. What he has seem is certainly,  unmistakably suspicious. Why did Mr. Carpenter lie to him What does he want the flashlight for and where is he goin Bobby decides he's got to find out. Hurriedly he laces on the shoe he had taken off, and peers out the door to find the hall clear. He slips out the door, closing it behind  him.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Klaatu is walking down the dark, semi-deserted street wit the determined stride of a man with a definite objective.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Half a block behind, he's following Klaatu, eagerly, flus with a sense of excitement and adventure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking along the sidewalk, Klaatu turns into a side stre disappearing from view around the corner. In a moment, Bo hurries into scene breathlessly. He pulls up for a moment rest. Then, getting his breath, he dashes on around the c after Klaatu.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: This is a temporary structure that has been erected to en the space ship and Gort. In front of the one small door a two soldiers, standing guard. Concealed in some foregroun foliage, studying the layout, is Klaatu. Nearby 's a sign reading: KEEP OUT! This area OFF LIMITS to the public. U. ARMY.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: He is a short distance away, watching Klaatu eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: KLAATU
dialogues.text: as he studies the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shooting over Klaatu's shoulder. As he watches, a Jeep fi with armed soldiers -- apparently regular patrol -- drive up to the entrance of the building. They stop for a momen while their Sergeant checks with the guards. Assured that everything is under control, the Sergeant signals his dri and the Jeep moves off.

dialogues.speaker: KLAATU
dialogues.text: Scanning the side of the building, he sees what he's look for. Waiting until the Jeep disappears, he starts toward side of the building, keeping himself concealed in the  foliage.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: puzzled and interested, as he watches Klaatu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two sentries standing in front of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Klaatu maneuvers around the side of the building, wher there is a window. It has no glass in it but is heavily  barred.

dialogues.speaker: KLAATU
dialogues.text: as he leaves the concealing foliage and crosses the clear grassy area surrounding the building. He stops and tries see through the window.

dialogues.speaker: GORT
dialogues.text: shooting through the barred window into the building. The huge robot looms large and eerie in the shadows cast by a couple of naked work-lights. His head is angled, away fro the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Klaatu approaches the window. Aiming his flashlight at Gort, he flashes the light intermittently, as though  signaling. (This should not approximate any known code.)

dialogues.speaker: GORT
dialogues.text: As we watch, the intermittent flashes of Klaatu's light a on the wall ahead of Gort. Slowly, evenly, the robot's he turns to face the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from Gort's viewpoint, of the window, with Klaatu's light flashing its signals.

dialogues.speaker: KLAATU
dialogues.text: shooting on his back, as he finishes signaling and cuts o the flashlight. He turns ant starts back for the concealm of the foliage.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: craning his neck to look for Klaatu, who has eluded his v Suddenly he sees Klaatu again.

dialogues.speaker: KLAATU
dialogues.text: making his way behind the foliage toward the front of the building. Arriving at a point opposite the entrance, Klaa waits and watches.

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE TO BUILDING
dialogues.text: The two guards are standing in the doorway in positions o relaxed alertness. Suddenly, inside the building behind t the giant figure of Gort looms silently in the doorway. H two great arms reach out, grab the two guards and drag th back inside the building.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: He lets out an inaudible gasp as he sees this. Bug-eyed, glances quickly to the point where he last saw Klaatu. He amazed at what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from Bobby's viewpoint. Klaatu has emerged from the  concealment of the tree-lined path and is making his way  calmly toward the entrance of the building.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: As he watches Klaatu enter the building, his curiosity  conquers his fear and he starts tremblingly toward the  structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Klaatu enters. The huge shapes of the space ship and G loom large and eerie. Klaatu starts across the barren  enclosure toward the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bobby approaches the door, fearful but fascinated. He  peers cautiously inside and his eyes grow wide as saucers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In *f.g., near the door, the two guards lie unconscious. Klaatu walks toward the ship Gort slowly turns his head t follow him with him with eyes. Klaatu touches a point on unbroken surface of the ship and the ramp silently swings out and down to the ground. Klaatu mounts the ramp and  disappears inside the ship, whereupon the ramp silently  closes.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: as he watches this; his eyes bulging. He can scarcely bel what he has seen. Suddenly a wave of sheer terror sweeps  over him. Scrambling to his feet, he turns and runs wildl away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FOLLOWS Klaatu as he moves down the tiny, dimly li entrance corridor. He steps into the main cabin of the sh and flips a switch which bathes the cabin in a diffused,  shadowless light. The walls are lined with a complex of  mysterious gadgetry -- knobs, dials, indicators, etc. All this should be as imaginative and unorthodox as possible, while still retaining a feeling of sound but highly advan engineering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Klaatu moves to the communications panel, flipping swi and turning dials. Indicators light up. There are crackli whirring and buzzing sounds. Klaatu starts speaking into built-in microphone in his own strange language. He speak in rapid-fire explanation, continuing to talk, as we--

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: as Klaatu walks calmly away from the ship, past the two  unconscious guards and disappears out of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as one of them slowly regains consciousness. Looking arou he sees the great figure of Gort and is terror-stricken. shakes his companion frantically in an effort to bring hi to.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LIVING ROOM BOARDINGHOUSE NIGHT
dialogues.text: Bobby is curled up in a chair waiting for his mother to c home. He's sleepy, but the excitement of what he has seen precluded any such possibility. From the hall we hear the front door opening as Helen and Tom come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off scene) Why don't you come on in for a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen and Tom appear in the doorway, Helen is startled to see Bobby, who has Jumped up and run toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby--! What are you doing up at  this hour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitedly) I couldn't go to sleep, Mom. I had  to tell you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the words tadpole  out breathlessly) I followed Mr. Carpenter -- right  after you left -- and, gee, Mom,  where do you think he went? Right  into the space ship!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patiently disbelieving) Now, Bobby, just a minute--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honest, Mom, I saw him. It just opened  up and he walked right in. And that  great big iron man was moving around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, you've been dreaming again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately) No, I haven't, Mom. I promise you...  I saw it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen and Tom exchange a glance of tolerant amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you see all this, Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the lawn down at the mall -- in  that place with the soldiers out  front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to trap him) Where were the soldiers all this  time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That robot fella grabbed 'em and  dragged 'em inside! (his lips trembling) I like Mr. Carpenter -- but I'm  scared, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes into Helen's arms, clutching her desperately, t to hold back his tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding him close to  her sympathetically) Mustn't be frightened, darling -- It  was just a bad dream. Here -- we'll  prove it to you. (with a look and a  nod to Tom) Tom, will you ask Mr. Carpenter if  he'll come down for a minute. (Tom turns to go) The room right opposite mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nodding, Tom disappears into the hall and up the stairs.  Still holding Bobby, Helen tries to dispel his fears by a appeal to logic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now think back hard. You didn't follow  Mr. Carpenter at all, did you? You  haven't even been out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I have!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (determinedly) You didn't really see the space ship.  You just thought you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitterly hurt, Bobby faces his mother gravely, accusingly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd never call you a liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is knocking softly at Klaatu's door. Getting no answe he tries the door, pushes it open and peers in. Then he s into the darkened room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom snaps on the light and looks around the empty room. T bed is still made. Glancing around, Tom's eye is caught b flash of something bright on the floor below the dresser. stoops down and picks up a fair-sized diamond. Tom studie the stone curiously, holding it up to the light. Thorough puzzled, he keeps the stone in his hand, switches off the light and goes out.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS HALL
dialogues.text: Closing the door, Tom hurries along the hall and down the stairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the hall door Tom can be seen coming down the sta Helen and Bobby watch expectantly as he enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not there. (crossing to Helen) But look what I found in his room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes the stone and  studies it, amazed  by its size) Is it real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with the shrug of an  amateur) Looks real to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Carpenter's got a lot of diamonds. (he digs into his  pocket) He gave me a couple of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen takes the two diamonds Bobby holds out in his hand, looking at them in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gave these to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (guilty for his own  sharp dealing) Well, not exactly. I gave him two  dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't make sense... I think  the guy's a crook. I never did trust  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen tries to shush Tom, not wanting to re-stimulate Bob imagination, but it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, Mom, do you think maybe he's a  diamond smuggler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) Come on, darling -- we're going up  to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if we ought to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off with  a look) Bobby and I have had enough excitement  for tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seriously concerned) You think it's all right for you to  stay here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods reassuringly) I've got a good lock on my door. (smiling at Bobby) And Bobby's going to sleep in my  room tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, boy -- can I, Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, dear. Come on now. (she happens to look  down at his feet.  Puzzled, and  concerned, she feels  his shoes) Bobby, your shoes are soaking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctantly, with  childish guilt) Yeah -- the grass was kind of wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the impact of this sinks in, Helen and Tom turn to sta at each other in questioning consternation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a typical government office, with lots of desks in Helen is at her desk, straightening it up to go to lunch. This done, she moves briskly to get her coat. CAMERA PANS follow her and suddenly, startlingly reveals Klaatu stand near the clothes rack, as though he had materialized out thin air. Helen is thoroughly startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unnerved) Oh -- hello--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I see you for a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- I was Just going to lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly insistent) May I walk out with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is nervous and uneasy but obviously can't refuse. The telephone on her desk rings and Helen turns to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Mrs. Benson speaking. (recognizing the voice,  she glances nervously  at Klaatu) Oh, hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a rather swank shop. Tom is standing at the counter  phoning. The Jeweler is behind the counter examining a st through his eyepiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone, cheerily) I'm at Bleeker's getting an appraisal  on that diamond. I thought we might  have lunch together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a nervous glance  at Klaatu) I -- I'm afraid I can't -- not right  now. Can I talk to you later?. Yes,  that'll be fine. 'Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up and smiles uneasily as she rejoins Klaatu an leads the way out into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES with Helen and Klaatu as they go down the  corridor. Klaatu's mood is one of quiet tension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching Helen's  reaction) I saw Bobby this morning before he  went to school--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at him  apprehensively) Yes--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know what he told you last  night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous and evasive) I -- I didn't really pay much  attention-- (with a nervous little  laugh) Bobby has such an active imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (refusing to be put  off) Did you believe what he told you? (Helen hesitates,  trapped by uncertainty) I have a reason for asking this -- a  very important reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are approaching the elevator at the end of the corri There is a large crowd of lunch-goers milling around the  elevator, which is quickly filled. Half the crowd is left the elevator doors close and it descends.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN AND KLAATU
dialogues.text: Nervous and distracted, Helen doesn't want to get caught in this jam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's another elevator we can use--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods toward a side corridor and starts for it, Klaatu following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FOLLOWS them as they turn into the side corridor.  Helen leads the way to a small, automatic elevator. She  presses the button and the doors open. Klaatu follows her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Helen presses the first floor button, the doors close the elevator starts down. She turns to face Klaatu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her nerves raw and  edgy) What is it you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I ask you to be honest with  me, perhaps I should be completely  honest with you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without warning the elevator comes to a jolting, jarring  stop as the power is cut off and the lights go out. The c is illuminated faintly and eerily by light that seeps thr the ventilating grills from a skylight in the shaft. Hele is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping with fright) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a moment's hesitation;  then he remembers) What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen fumbles to get her wrist watch into a faint beam of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just twelve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be stuck here for a little  while -- about thirty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (preoccupied with her  own thinking) We could try pushing the other  buttons. (digging in her purse) I have a flashlight in my purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen has the flashlight out and is snapping it on, but i doesn't work. She looks up at him blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment,  quietly) You see -- the electricity's been  neutralized -- all over the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The impact of this calm, quiet statement is shattering. H stares at him awe-struck. Then she speaks numbly, almost  inaudibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby was telling the truth -- wasn't  he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaatu stares at her evenly, as we--

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: All vehicular traffic in the street is at a dead stop.  Automobiles, busses, trolley cars -- all are stalled. Dri and passengers are climbing out of the vehicles in utter  bewilderment. Except for the people, it is as though the  street had been frozen in motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great generators and dynamos are silent and motionles in the dim, unlighted plant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge automobile or airplane assembly line, with nothing moving, no machinery going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giant presses are threaded with newsprint, but they a silent and motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of engineers are working feverishly over a huge complicated control panel. They are working by the light two incongruous and ineffectual candles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People carne pouring up the stairs wildly, feverishly anx to escape the darkness below. Their eyes blink weakly in unaccustomed sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars, taxis and busses are stalled, their frenzied driver unable to figure out what's happened. A junk peddler with broken-down horse and wagon moves grandly and leisurely  through the stalled vehicles. The peddler bears a happy g of superiority. This is his moment of triumph over modern civilization.

dialogues.speaker: TIMES SQUARE
dialogues.text: with all traffic stalled.

dialogues.speaker: TIMES SQUARE
dialogues.text: of two cab drivers whose taxis have stalled beside each o in traffic. One has gotten out of his cab. The other is s at his wheel, looking around in awe and terror, his tough Manhattan heart shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ol' lady was right. We shoulda  got a place in the country.

dialogues.speaker: PICCADILLY CIRCUS
dialogues.text: with all traffic stalled. (It is about 5:00 P.M.)

dialogues.speaker: TWO COCKNEYS
dialogues.text: standing on the sidewalk, awe-struck at the weird sight b them. One of them speaks in terror, hardly daring to  articulate his thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that space man -- that's wot it  is.

dialogues.speaker: MOSCOW STREET
dialogues.text: with all traffic stalled. (It is about 8:00 P.M.)

dialogues.speaker: TWO RUSSIANS
dialogues.text: They are an elderly couple. Staring bug-eyed at the stran street scene, the woman mutters some terror-stricken comm in Russian.

dialogues.speaker: PLAZA. DE LA CONCORDE
dialogues.text: with traffic stalled. (It is about 5:00 P.M.)

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH WOMAN
dialogues.text: She is middle-aged and there are tears of fright in her e She is mumbling a prayer in French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnhardt is seated comfortably at his desk with a book o his lap. He has been interrupted by the entrance of Hilda his secretary. At the moment she`s beside herself with  excitement. Barnhardt watches her with a half-smile of se amusement. He has already deduced the cause of what's  happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should see it, Professor  Barnhardt! You should go out and see  it for yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks -- I'm enjoying it right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole city has stopped. People  are running around like ants!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (musing admiringly on  Klaatu's cleverness) What a brilliant idea. I never would  have thought of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hilda flings him a questioning look, annoyed that he won' share her excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the people who are coming  to the meeting tonight? Have they  all arrived?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) I talked to most of them this  morning... They were all very curious  about the meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Did you speak to our friend  Mr. Carpenter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) He'll be there at 8:30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studying her for a  moment) Tell me, Hilda -- does all this  frighten you -- does it make you  feel insecure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir -- it certainly does!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding with a bland  little smile) That's good, Hilda. I'm glad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The poor woman flings him a look of shocked amazement as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seated at a conference table are high-ranking officers of the Army, Navy, Air Force and Marine Corps. There is the  uneasy tension of people dealing with unknown forces. An  Army Major General, who's Chairman of the meeting, is  speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --as far as we can tell, all power's  been cut off everywhere -- with a  few exceptions: hospitals, planes in  flight -- that sort of thing. I wish  I could be more specific but, as you  now, all communications are out  telephone, radio, cable -- everything. (gravely) I can tell you that the President is  prepared to declare a state of  national emergency. (pausing to let this  sink in) Before we start discussing plans, I  want a report from Colonel Ryder.  What about the robot, Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryder is a Colonel of engineers, a man about forty-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it was discovered last night  that the robot had moved, I was  directed by the Joint Chiefs to find  a means of immobilizing him. We  accomplished that this morning by  encasing him in a block of KL 93. (he hands a small  block of plastic to  the General) It's a new plastic material --  stronger than steel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it possible that he's broken out  of this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. I've Just checked on that.  He's locked up tight as a drum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right -- that means we concentrate  on the man. (to the group with  force and authority) Up till now we've agreed on the  desirability of capturing this man  alive. We can no longer afford to be  so particular. We'll get him alive,  if possible -- but we must get him! (eyes the group sternly) Is that clear?

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND JEWELER
dialogues.text: The shop and its glittering display cases, which were  brilliantly lighted in the previous scene, are now gloomy and dim. All artificial light is off. The Jeweler is a br eyed old man of seventy with a middle European accent. He completely fascinated as he examines the diamond Tom has  given him, and is annoyed by the lack of light. He speaks impatiently to one of the girls in the shop who happens t pass by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleanor, did you call the electrician?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she's not too bright) I tried, Mr. Bleeker. But the phone  doesn't work, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (absently, as he  studies the stone) Well, call the phone company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (plaintively) But the phone doesn't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeweler gives her a preoccupied glance of annoyance a turns back to the stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it worth anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have never seen such a stone. Will  you please tell me where it came  from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I wanted you to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overwhelmed and  absorbed by the stone,  he shakes his head,  bewildered) There are no diamonds like this --  any place in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impressed by the import of what the man is saying, Tom's  mind is racing wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eagerly, shrewdly) Would you like to sell it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up the stone) No -- no, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd give you a very good price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Preoccupied with his own excited thoughts, Tom has alread started for the door.

dialogues.speaker: KLAATU AND HELEN
dialogues.text: In the dim light of the stalled elevator, Klaatu is finis explaining to Helen the story of his mission. Overwhelmed the staggering import of what he has told her, Helen is  listening with great interest and concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaking gravely) --I've already told you more than I  told Professor Barnhardt, because my  life, in a sense, is in your hands.  I thought if you knew the facts you'd  appreciate the importance of my not  being -- apprehended, -- before the  meeting tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen is staring at him in awe, but also in complete  admiration and sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course. Of course I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaatu smiles at her warmly and she manages to return the smile. Their relationship is further cemented by the shar of this vital secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studying his face  anxiously) You hold great hope for this meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see no other hope for your  planet. If the meeting should fail,  then I'm afraid there is no hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly and without warning, the elevator starts moving the lights go on. Startled, Helen looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) It must be twelve-thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at her watch,  then back at him,  awe-struck) Yes -- Just exactly.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Showing a section of street traffic as it comes back to l From everywhere comes the sound of self-starters. Trolley bells start clanging. Then automobile horns. People climb back into there vehicles and traffic starts to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of other streets, as the strident sounds of traffic build and normalcy is regained.

dialogues.speaker: DA
dialogues.text: as Helen and Klaatu come out of the elevator and start ac the lobby, CAMERA HOLDING ON THEM. Helen is preoccupied w concern for Klaatu's safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to the boardinghouse. I'll be  safe there for the afternoon -- and  I can keep an eye on Bobby. He's the  only other person who knows anything  about--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This recalls to Helen something she had forgotten and she stops in sudden concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, wait a minute -- there's someone  else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom... He was there last night when  Bobby told me what he saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The look of concern on Klaatu's face heightens Helen's  overwhelming fear and uncertainty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worriedly) Of course, he doesn't know anything  definite. He'd talk to me first,  anyway, before-- (interrupting herself  in sudden decision) We can't take that chance. I'll get  in touch with him right away and  make sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen turns and starts determinedly for the lobby door,  followed by Klaatu, as we--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen is nervous and worried as she speaks into the phone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) --But I've got to talk to him. It's  terribly important. When is he coming  back?

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Tom's secretary has not yet recovered from the shock of w has happened to the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Mrs. Benson. He left  before noon -- before that awful  electric business. I'm scared to  death, Mrs. Benson. I -- No, he  wouldn't tell me where he was gong.  Said it was something personal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him I want to see him the minute  he gets in... No, I'll call back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen hangs up, thoroughly worried and distraught now.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSPAPER HEADLINE
dialogues.text: The headline reads: WORLD-WIDE POWER JAMMED PRESIDENT DEC EMERGENCY STEP UP HUNT FOR SPACE MAN.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: at passenger loading gate. A group of passengers is held  back as soldiers close the gate to the runway, preventing their boarding their plane. The passengers mill about in  consternation as a voice is heard over a p.a. system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention, please.... All flights  from National Airport have been  canceled until further notice.. All  flights from this airport have been  canceled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.P.'s are blocking the gates leading to trains and ticke takers are busy explaining matters and remonstrating with irate ticket holders.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Passengers are being herded off a loaded bus that was  preparing to leave the depot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Army has thrown a roadblock across a main highway on outskirts of the city and is permitting no one to leave.  From the line of halted cars we see and the insistent hon of horns we hear, we get the impression of hundreds of ca stacked up.

dialogues.speaker: DUSK
dialogues.text: It is 6:00 P.M. and growing dark outside, but the lights not on. The office is small and unpretentious, the busine habitat of a man who works in a big insurance agency. Tom secretary is on the phone, reflecting the world-wide terr of the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone, nervous  and jittery) --Honest, Mary, I'm so scared I can't  sit still. I'd like to run some place,  but I don't know where to go-- (hearing the door  open, she cuts off) 'Bye now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corridor door opens and Tom enters with an air of urg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the Pentagon and find out who's  in charge of this space man business.  Whoever it is I want to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The secretary has a reaction of surprise, but she manages stop Tom at his door. He has flipped on the lights in pas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Benson's been trying to get you  all afternoon. She says it's  important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get this other call first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom disappears into his office, closing the door. The  secretary is getting out a telephone directory when the  corridor door opens and Helen enters, tense and nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Mrs. Benson -- He just walked  in. (misery loves company) Are you nervous, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am, Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The secretary buzzes the intercom and speaks into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Benson is here. (turning to Helen) Go on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen is starting for the door when it opens and Tom appe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom -- I've been trying to get you  all afternoon--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (preoccupied with his  own excitement) Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Tom follows Helen inside and closes the door. He turns her, his voice tense with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got some terrific news about  your friend, Mr. Carpenter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to appear  calm) What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen, he's the man from the space  ship! (she eyes him evenly,  apprehensively, as  he hurries on) I had that diamond checked at three  different places. Nobody on earth's  ever seen a stone like that! After  what Bobby told us, that's enough  for me. Why is it nobody knows  anything about him? Why hasn't he  got any money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evenly, with quiet  tension) All right, Tom -- it's true. I know  it's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind about that. (urgently, with great  concern) You've got to promise me you won't  say a word to anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? After what happened  today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand. You don't  realize how important it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently) Important? Of course it's important.  The point is we can do something  about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm trying to tell you.  We mustn't do anything about it.  Believe me, Tom, I know what I'm  talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated by her  opposition) He's a menace to the whole world!  It's our duty to turn him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately) But he isn't a menace! He told me  what he came here for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissing this with  annoyed contempt) He told you... Don't be silly, honey --  just because you like the guy. (busy with his own  thoughts) You realize what this'd mean for us?  I'd be the biggest man in the country.  I could write my own ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing him coldly) Is that what you're thinking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (guiltily, defensive) Why not? Somebody's got to get rid  of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are interrupted by the sharp sound of the interoffic buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to let you do it, Tom. (with deep personal  urgency) Believe me, this is literally the  most important thing in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom picks up the phone and answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes?... What's his name, Margaret?  General Cutler? (disappointed that  the connection isn't  completed) All right, I'll hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Realizing what he's doing, Helen crosses to him, pleading wildly, desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, you mustn't -- ! You don't know  what you're doing! It isn't just you  and Mr. Carpenter. The rest of the  world, is involved!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated) I don't care about the rest of the  world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is as though he had slapped her across the face. Sudde he has revealed himself, naked and distasteful. Feeling g as he sees the contempt and revulsion in her eyes, he tri the old charm, holding his hand over the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll feel different when you see  my picture in the papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at him starkly) I feel different right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uneasily) You wait and see. You're going to  marry a big hero!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to marry anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and runs quickly out of the room. Tom's inclina is to follow her, when his connection is completed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello, General Cutler? (irritated) No, I don't want to speak to his  aide. I want to speak to the General.  Tell him it's about the space man...  My name is Tom Stevens. S-t-e-v-e-n- s.

dialogues.speaker: DUSK
dialogues.text: Helen hurries out of the building, hails a cab, gets into and the cab drives off.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Tom now has General Cutler on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) That's right, General. That's where  he's staying... Yes, of course I'm  sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The General is on the phone and is making notes. There ar couple of officers standing near his desk, a Colonel and Lieutenant Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after listening for  a moment) Thank you very much, Mr. Stevens.  I'll want to talk to you further but  I haven't time now. (hangs up and turns  to Colonel) Deploy all Zone 5 units according to  Plan B -- immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Colonel nods and starts out of the room, as we--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: The cab is traveling through city traffic. Nervous and ed Helen glances at her watch impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jeep filled with armed soldiers is moving down the stre at a fast clip. Behind the jeep is an Army staff car.

dialogues.speaker: STAFF CAR
dialogues.text: shooting from outside into the car. In the front seat bes the driver is a full Colonel, wearing helmet and side-arm The car is moving swiftly through traffic as the Colonel  speaks into the transmitter of a radio.

dialogues.speaker: COMMAND AND RECONNAISSANCE CAR
dialogues.text: It is filled with soldiers wearing helmets and carrying r and Tommy guns. It is traveling quite fast. A soldier wit handy-talkie transmits an order to the driver.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: The C. and R. car is seen to be at the head of a convoy o eight Army vehicles which are moving swiftly down the str The trucks are filled with armed soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER STREET
dialogues.text: On this street also an armed convoy is racing by, headed a Jeep mounting a .30 caliber machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER STREET
dialogues.text: On this street also a convoy rolls by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen's cab rounds the corner into the boardinghouse stre CAMERA PANS with cab as it draws up in front of the  boardinghouse. The cab waits as Helen jumps out and runs the steps to the front door. A couple of children are pla jump-rope in the light of a street lamp.

dialogues.speaker: STAFF CAR
dialogues.text: shooting in at the Colonel as he issues an order into the radio.

dialogues.speaker: ARMY CONVOY
dialogues.text: CAMERA FOLLOWS the rear of the convoy as it races down a  main thoroughfare. As the convoy reaches each intersectio the last vehicle peels off the column and, turns into the side street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: racing down another street, the rear vehicles peeling off the intersections as in previous scene.

dialogues.speaker: INTERSECTION
dialogues.text: Following one of the vehicles after it has peeled off int side street. It turns around in the side street and draws facing the intersection, its motor still running. We get impression of a methodical plan to block off each street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Klaatu and Helen come hurrying down the steps and pile into the waiting taxi. The kids playing Jump-rope stop an watch as the door is closed and the cab pulls out,  disappearing as it makes a right turn at the end of the  street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (This is opposite end of street from last shot.) Barrelin across the intersection into the boardinghouse street is jeep followed by the Colonel's staff car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Jeep and staff car pull up in front of the boardin house, the soldiers in the jeep pile out and cover the  entrance to the house. Meanwhile the Colonel, still in th staff car, is talking to the two kids playing out front.  They chatter excitedly, pointing in the direction taken b the cab.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: He speaks into his radio in tones of clipped and quiet  efficiency. The car remains standing at the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Attention, Zone 5... Yellow cab,  moving north on B from Ninth Street.  Man and woman in back seat. Get the  license number and report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab 's moving through traffic at a normal speed. Klaa and Helen are tense and nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab's moving through traffic at a normal speed. Klaat and Helen are tense and nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure Barnhardt can arrange to  hide me until the meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the meeting going to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the ship.

dialogues.speaker: CAB DRIVER
dialogues.text: as he looks out to his left, approaching an intersection. From driver's viewpoint. A C. and R. car is parked in the side street, facing the intersection, its occupants armed and helmeted.

dialogues.speaker: CAB DRIVER
dialogues.text: Abreast of the intersection now, he looks to his right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shooting over the rear of a jeep which is halted in a sid street facing the intersection. The cab crosses the  intersection and the jeep driver squints to catch its num Then he picks up his radio and speaks into the transmitte

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL
dialogues.text: (The car is still in front of the boardinghouse.) The Col listens to his radio for a moment, then speaks into his  transmitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Attention, Zone 5... license number  of target vehicle is W 4936... All  vehicles maintain your positions --  and hold your fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shooting at the driver, over the shoulders of Klaatu and  Helen, as he turns and points out the Army vehicles to th with a shrug of bewilderment. They look ahead at the  intersection they are approaching.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: looking ahead out of her side of the cab, at the intersec

dialogues.speaker: INTERSECTION
dialogues.text: from Helen's viewpoint. There is an Army vehicle waiting the side street.

dialogues.speaker: KLAATU
dialogues.text: as he looks out of his side of the cab.

dialogues.speaker: INTERSECTION
dialogues.text: In this side street, too, an Army vehicle is standing.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN AND KLAATU
dialogues.text: Their eyes meet for a moment, neither willing to conjectu what this might mean. The very quietness of the operation ominous and menacing. Their faces show grave concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Attention, Zone 5 -- report when  target vehicle passes your position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shooting through the window at Helen and Klaatu, who are  growing more tense and nervous.

dialogues.speaker: INTERSECTION
dialogues.text: shooting over the back of a jeep mounting a machine gun a the cab passes the intersection. The driver picks up his  radio and reports into it.

dialogues.speaker: WEAPONS CARRIER
dialogues.text: shooting through the windshield as the driver reports by  radio, his eyes shifting to follow the moving cab.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN AND KLAATU
