dialogues.text: Helen is biting her lips nervously. She steals a sidelong glance at Klaatu to find him staring ahead, deeply preocc and concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to give him  encouragement) It's only a few blocks to Barnhardt's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried about Gort. I'm afraid  of what he might do -- if anything  should happen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gort? (puzzled) But he's a robot. I mean -- without  you, what could he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly) There's no limit to what he could  do. He could destroy the Earth. (with great urgency) If anything should happen to me, you  must go to Gort. You must give him  this message: "Klaatu barada nikto."  Please repeat that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked and  bewildered, she  repeats nervously) "Klaatu barada nikto."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gravely) Remember those words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen nods, repeating the words soundlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of vehicle drivers reporting by radio as their eyes follo the progress of the taxi. (These should be shot so we don hear what is said.)

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL IN STAFF CAR
dialogues.text: listening to these reports. Then he speaks into his  transmitter with quiet tension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Attention, Zone 5... Section number  2 -- block off Tenth Street at  Massachusetts. All vehicles close  in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Colonel motions to his driver and the staff car pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as a convoy of eight vehicles moves down the street going very fast and swings around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of individual vehicles that have been waiting at  intersections, as they pull out and down the main streets converge on the taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at a major intersection, as the convoy of eight vehicles  previously seen dashes through the intersection and stops The cars quickly arrange themselves so that they form a  roadblock, completely sealing off the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shooting over the driver's shoulder. The cab is proceedin down the street. When the road block comes into range of headlights. The driver, who has been getting uneasy, turn to face his fares accusingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's this all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he slows his cab down, Helen leans forward into scene. Frenzied, she is about to urge the driver on when Klaatu  puts a restraining hand on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shooting down the street from the barricade, as the taxi  stops. Army cars are closing in behind the taxi, so it is trapped. The cab door ovens and Klaatu steps out, making run for the entrance to a pedestrian underpass.

dialogues.speaker: JEEP
dialogues.text: It is one of the lead vehicles in the group coming up beh the taxi. It mounts a .30 caliber machine gun and, with t Jeep still moving, the gunner fires a burst at Klaatu.

dialogues.speaker: RIFLEMAN
dialogues.text: He's on one of the vehicles that form the barricade. He t a bead on the running figure of Klaatu and fires.

dialogues.speaker: KLAATU
dialogues.text: He has almost reached the underpass. His hand is on the  railing when he slumps to the ground, badly hit. In a mom Helen rushes into scene, dropping down to hold Klaatu's h in her arms. He looks up at her with a feeble smile. Then his face takes on an expression of urgency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly, insistently) Get that message to Gort. Right away--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaatu is unable to say any more. He is dead. Helen looks around wildly, helplessly, with tears and terror in her e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the soldiers pile out of their vehicles and close in o the place where Klaatu lies. He is their first and all- important concern, and Helen finds herself pushed out of way, toward the edge of the growing crowd of soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shocked and, staggered by what's happened, she realizes s must get to Gort. Taking advantage of the milling confusi in the dark, she edges toward the pedestrian underpass un she can slip into its entrance without being noticed. And she disappears.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: In the eerie light of the huge building, the great robot  stands encased in a solid block of clear, transparent pla As CAMERA MOVES IN slowly, we hear a low whirring sound, of power being generated. A faint glow, visible through t plastic, emanates from Gort's body. His eyes, which seem express rage, shifts as though he were straining to break out. As the whirring sound and the glow of Gort's body  increase in intensity, the sharp edges at the top of the like block melt into roundness and the plastic starts to  drip away. (About 150 folding chairs are arranged on the  floor near the space ship for the meeting tonight.)

dialogues.speaker: TWO SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: The whirring sound can be heard faintly from inside. The soldiers standing guard at the door hear the sound and li apprehensively. The two men exchange an uneasy glance. Af hesitating a moment, one of them decides to investigate. turns and goes inside the door.

dialogues.speaker: THE SOLDIER
dialogues.text: As he stops and looks up at the robot, his eyes go wide w terror.

dialogues.speaker: GORT
dialogues.text: Gort is an awesome and terrifying sight. His head is free now and he seems to be straining against the plastic, whi is dripping down the sides of the block.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: He glances around nervously to see that his companion has entered the building and is staring up at the robot, bug- eyed. Slowly the second soldier moves up beside the first Wordlessly, they bring their rifles up to the ready and c them off safety. In spite of their terror, they advance s toward the robot.

dialogues.speaker: GORT
dialogues.text: The whirring sound is ominous and his body glows brightly And his eyes are fixed on the two advancing figures.

dialogues.speaker: TWO SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: as they move toward Gort.

dialogues.speaker: GORT
dialogues.text: From inside him comes a new and terribly sharp crackling. sound. And from his eyes two pencils of light dart out. A a moment the crackling sound stops and the light goes off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from same angle as scene before last. But the two soldier have utterly disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Gort resumes breaking out of the plastic. There is no  sign of the two soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Hurrying along a footpath, nervous and distraught, she pa for a moment, looking at the entrance of the building. Th she starts determinedly across the grass toward the entra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PANNING with Helen as she approaches the entrance fearful Rallying all her courage and determination, she forces he to step inside.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: as she enters the huge, weirdly lighted building. She sto short as her glance falls on the awesome figure of Gort.  Loneliness and terror grip her and she wants to run -- bu she realizes she can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has seen Helen and his flashing eyes bore into her. Hi upper body and arms are free now, and the plastic is rapi melting away.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: She is held fascinated by the robot's staring eyes. For  another moment it looks as if she would, break and run. B she summons all her courage, and moves slowly toward Gort whose legs are still held captive.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN AND GORT
dialogues.text: as she moves slowly, fearfully toward him.

dialogues.speaker: GORT
dialogues.text: The plastic is dripping off his legs now. With great effo he pulls his legs free and steps out of the stuff. A huge figure in the heavy shadows, he moves slowly and menacing toward Helen.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: as she stops advancing, rooted to the spot in fear. Then starts backing away, keeping her eyes on him.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN AND GORT
dialogues.text: As the great, hulking figure approaches, Helen can't stan her ground. She turns and runs wildly toward the far end the building. Gort follows her with unhurried, inescapabl strides. Unwittingly, Helen has run into a corner, and th robot is closing in on her.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Her eyes go wide with terror as she realizes she's trappe In a wild effort to run around him, she stumbles and fall to the floor. Immobilized with fright, she lies breathles looking up at him. Then she gives a piercing scream.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN AND GORT
dialogues.text: as the great robot bends over her menacingly, arms  outstretched as though to grab or smash her.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: All hope gone, she is blessed with a moment of lucidity, she remembers the message Klaatu told her to deliver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gort--! (with desperate clarity) Klaatu -- barada -- nikto.

dialogues.speaker: GORT
dialogues.text: He pauses as he hears the words. His face doesn't change  expression, but the words obviously have an effect on him He hesitates thoughtfully for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN AND GORT
dialogues.text: Helen watches him in an agony of suspense. Then the robot slowly bends down, picks her up in his arms and starts wa toward the space ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PANNING with Gort as he carries Helen, speechless with fr to the side of the ship. He touches the side, and the ram moves slightly out. He mounts the ramp, still carrying He and disappears into the ship with her. And the ramp close silently behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FOLLOWS as Gort carries Helen through the dimly li corridor into the main cabin, where he flips a switch tha lights up the cabin. The robot proceeds to a small door  leading off the main cabin and disappears with Helen insi it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is revealed as a weirdly equipped laboratory, the wa of which are lined with the most complex array of mechani and electronic apparatus. Gort sets Helen down on a stool and indicates for her to stay there. Too terrified to mov Helen watches as he busies himself with the apparatus. He starts flipping switches and turning dials. As a result,  lights begin to flash and there's a strange series of  mechanical noises.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Unable to guess the reason for these preparations, she is gripped with a terrible fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignoring Helen completely, Gort finishes his work. Then h moves to the door and goes out, closing the door behind h Helen rushes to the door and searches frantically for the knob -- only to find, to her terror, that there is none.  Frenziedly she beats on the solid metal door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the ramp comes down and Gort steps out. With grim,  determined strides he starts toward the entrance of the  building as the ramp silently closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Colonel who was in charge of Klaatu's apprehension is speaking into a phone at the desk of the Police Sergeant. Standing by are three or four Army officers, among them a Captain and a Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes, sir, we've got the body here  now. Downstairs in a cell... No  question about it, General -- he's  dead all right... Yes, sir. Yes -- I  understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The General has apparently hung up and the Colonel does  likewise, turning to the officers in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Cutler's coming down here  right away. (to the Lieutenant) Take a squad of men, Lieutenant, and  post a guard around that cell. (to Captain) Captain, don't let anyone in or out  of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two officers mutter their "yes, sirs" and start off a their business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A squad of armed soldiers, led by the lieutenant, is admi to the corridor by a Police guard and they start marching down the corridor toward a cell at the far end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a cell on the ground floor. In the far wall is a  heavily barred window, beyond which is as alley. In f.g. Klaatu's feet, stretched out on a crude table. As CAMERA  HOLDS, the huge figure of Gort appears outside the barred window, Seeing Klaatu, he reaches up and yanks out the st bars as though they were chicken wire. With a crushing bl of his knee he crumbles the brick and mortar below the wi and steps inside the cell. He moves without interruption  toward the body of Klaatu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing the sounds of clattering metal and mortar, the  soldiers race down the corridor toward the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shooting over the backs of the soldiers as they reach the cell and look inside. There they see the giant robot pick up the body of Klaatu and starting deliberately toward th gaping hole in the side of the building. They raise their weapons and fire at Gort, but the bullets have no effect him. Continuing uninterruptedly, he steps over the debris and disappears, carrying Klaatu in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Gort enters the empty building, still carrying the bod of Klaatu. CAMERA PANS with him as he strides over to the ship. The ramp opens and Gort goes inside. Then the ramp  closes after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone in the cabin, Helen is still terrified. She looks u startled as the door opens and Gort enters, carrying Klaa body over to a long counter. Once again he starts fiddlin with knobs, switches and dials. As Helen watches, speechl he starts to fasten strange-looking electrodes to Klaatu' wrist and ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shooting from the outside, near the front entrance to the building, through a window into the main room where the P Sergeant's desk is. The Lieutenant who was ordered to gua Klaatu's cell is excitedly reporting to the Colonel how G broke in and took Klaatu's body. Considerably agitated, t Colonel snaps orders to the other officers, glances at hi watch and motions for the Lieutenant to follow him. He an the Lieutenant cross to the door and CAMERA PANS with the as they come outside the building, hurry down the steps a get into a staff car. Several other Army vehicles join th staff car as it roars away from the curb.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: A good many of the 150 chairs are filled, and more guests are still arriving. There is no one to greet them at the  door, so they wander in and seat themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gort is still working over the body of Klaatu. From a soc in the wall he pulls a strange-looking hypodermic needle the end of a cord or tube and gives Klaatu a shot in the  arm.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: as she watches, fascinated in spite of her terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gort fiddles with the dials again and there are electrica cracklings and sputterings. Suddenly he flips a switch an all sound ceases. Gort removes the electrodes and watches Klaatu. CAMERA MOVES IN on Klaatu and we see him start to breathe. In a moment his eyelids flutter. Then his eyes o and he looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Klaatu slowly lifts himself to a sitting position. Hel watches breathlessly as he glances around the room, as th to orient himself. Then he lowers his feet to the floor a stands up. He blinks uncertainly, then smiles at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a grateful glance  at Gort, he turns to  Helen) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at him) I -- I thought you were--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding, with a smile) I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Gort in  awe) You mean he has the power of life  and death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- that is a power reserved to  the Almighty Spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the  equipment Gort used) This technique, in certain cases,  can re-stimulate life for a limited  period. It's a refinement of  scientific principles known to your  own people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned for him) But how -- how long--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long will I live? (he shrugs) That no one can say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaatu moves one of the sliding panels and reaches for a  suit of his "other world" clothing from behind the panel. With a nod of apology, he steps behind the panel to chang

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: shooting from the door. In f.g. Barnhardt, who has just  arrived, is greeting several friends outside the door. In b.g. a staff car and three or four other Army vehicles ar driving up.

dialogues.speaker: ARMY VEHICLES
dialogues.text: As the convoy pulls up to a halt in front of the building the Colonel hurries out of the staff car and moves over t Barnhardt. Barnhardt is motioning his friends into the  building as the Colonel comes up to him.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL AND BARNHARDT
dialogues.text: The Colonel speaks to Barnhardt with deference but with  unyielding authority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Professor Barnhardt -- I  have to ask you to call off this  meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it off? I... But I had permission  from the Army--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you did. But the robots on  the loose now and it isn't safe around  here. You'll have to get your friends  out of that building.

dialogues.speaker: KLAATU AND HELEN
dialogues.text: as Klaatu steps out from behind the sliding panel where h has changed into his "other world" tunic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gort and I will be leaving soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen is genuinely upset at the thought of his leaving an the knowledge that he is to die. There is a compelling wa of feeling between these two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simply, sincerely) We'll miss you very much -- Bobby  and I. (smiling to conceal  her real feelings) He won't have anyone to play with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll have you -- and Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly -- definitely) No. That's all finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she is sensible and  objective, but not  unfeeling) I think I'm very lucky. You don't  always get a chance to recognize a  mistake before you make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaatu looks at her in warm, considered admiration. Then moves to one side of the cabin and flips a switch. Sudden an entire section of the side wall is made transparent.  Through it, as through a screen, we can see out into the  building. Most of the chairs are already occupied, and  latecomers are still moving in through the door. Facing t group, on a little dais, is Barnhardt. As Klaatu and Hele watch, Barnhardt raps for order and begins to speak. His  voice comes in the ship through a speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen--

dialogues.speaker: BARNHARDT
dialogues.text: He addresses them gravely, with a note of terrible  disappointment in his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called you from your work and from  your homes all over the world because  we were to meet here tonight with a  man from another planet -- the man  who came here in this ship. (there are audible  exclamations of  surprise and  disappointment) As you all know, this is no longer  possible. I can only say that I share  the bitterness of your disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT with the above are group and individual shots of the people in the meeting. They are the cream of Earth's  intellectuals -- scientists, churchmen, educators, leader of social and political thought. There are several women  among them. There are turbaned Indians, Chinese, Japanese several Negroes. All religions are represented. Every  important world power is represented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaatu and Helen are watching and listening, as the last  sentence of Barnhardt's speech above comes over the speak Klaatu flips off the switch, which cuts off the view of t meeting and also Barnhardt's voice. At this moment Gort m across the cabin and Klaatu speaks to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gort -- berengo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gort moves off obediently.

dialogues.speaker: BARNHARDT
dialogues.text: Full of chagrin, he continues addressing the meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --under the circumstances, the Army  people have asked us to leave the  building. And, since their concern  is for our safety, I can do nothing  but suggest that we comply--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnhardt is interrupted by the sudden and unexpected  appearance of the ramp, silently opening out of the side the space ship.

dialogues.speaker: BARNHARDT'S AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: as they react in startled amazement to the mysterious  appearance of the ramp. Then, as they watch, there is a s gasp of terror.

dialogues.speaker: AT SHIP
dialogues.text: as Gort appears on the ramp and walks slowly down to the  ground. In a moment, Klaatu and Helen appear at the entra of the ship. Helen comes down the ramp to join Barnhardt, while Klaatu remains at the head of the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Colonel stands near the door, flanked by a group of  soldiers, their rifles at the ready. The Colonel is start by what he sees. His eyes are on the revered figure of Kl and he's debating what he should do.

dialogues.speaker: KLAATU
dialogues.text: He is a figure of intense dignity in his impressive other tunic. He stares with even defiance at the armed soldiers as though holding them off by sheer weight of his persona He turns to look out at the audience, which is held  spellbound. Then, after a breathless moment, he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straightforwardly,  with almost stern  authority) I am leaving soon and you will forgive  me if I speak bluntly. (he pauses, studying  the faces) The Universe grows smaller every day --  and the threat of aggression by any  group -- anywhere -- can no longer  be tolerated.

dialogues.speaker: IN AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: of three of the delegates, listening intently. (These thr are from Russia, India and France.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over scene) There must be security for all -- or  no one is secure... This does not  mean giving up any freedom except  the freedom to act irresponsibly.

dialogues.speaker: A DELEGATE
dialogues.text: He is an American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over scene) Your ancestors knew this when they  made laws to govern themselves --  and hired policemen to enforce them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We of the other planets have long  accepted this principle. We have an  organization for the mutual protection  of all planets -- and for the complete  elimination of aggression. A sort of  United Nations on the Planetary  level... The test of any such higher  authority, of course, is the police  force that supports it. For our  policemen, we created a race of robots-- (indicating Gort) Their function is to patrol the  planets -- in space ships like this  one -- and preserve the peace. In  matters of aggression we have given  them absolute power over us.

dialogues.speaker: GORT
dialogues.text: emphasizing his great size and inscrutable expression. Th normal blinking of his piercing eyes as he gazes impertur at the audience is his only movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over scene) At the first sign of violence they  act automatically against the  aggressor. And the penalty for  provoking their action is too terrible  to risk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The result is that we live in peace,  without arms or armies, secure in  the knowledge that we are free from  aggression and war -- free to pursue  more profitable enterprises. (after a pause) We do not pretend to have achieved  perfection -- but we do have a system --  and it works. (with straightforward  candor) I came here to give you the facts.  It is no concern of ours how you run  your own planet -- but if you threaten  to extend your violence, this Earth  of yours will be reduced to a burned- out cinder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of four delegates, reflecting their stark terror and  bewilderment. And a cut of the Colonel and the soldiers,  impressed and held by what Klaatu is saying.

dialogues.speaker: KLAATU
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES SLOWLY as he concludes quietly, incisively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your choice is simple. Join us and  live in peace. Or pursue your present  course -- and face obliteration. (after a pause) We will be waiting for your answer.  decision rests with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time he reads the last line, the CAMERA HAS MOVED  INTO a BIG HEAD CLOSEUP.

dialogues.speaker: THE DELEGATES
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES along a row of their faces, stunned and sile their minds unable to cope with the enormity of what they have heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES IN on Klaatu as he is saying goodbye to Barn and Helen. He turns then and speaks to Gort, glancing up the building as he does so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gort -- veracto.

dialogues.speaker: GORT
dialogues.text: He looks up at the roof of the building, and once again w hear the peculiar generating sound from within him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: including the delegates, the space ship, everything that inside the building. As we watch, the roof and walls of t temporary structure suddenly disintegrate as the tanks di in the opening. The entire layout -- delegates, space shi and all -- remain exactly as they were except that instea of being under a roof they are out in the open Mall under starry sky. The area is ringed with the debris of the  building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaatu is standing at the head of the ramp as Gort comes the ramp and disappears inside the ship. Klaatu is noddin goodbye to Barnhardt and Helen.

dialogues.speaker: BARNHARDT AND HELEN
dialogues.text: as they wave to Klaatu. Barnhardt is moved and impressed, and Helen's face shows her emotions at this strange parti

dialogues.speaker: KLAATU
dialogues.text: He nods and smiles at them with warm affection. Then he t and disappears into the ship, and the ramp closes behind  him.

dialogues.speaker: THE SPACE SHIP
dialogues.text: From inside the ship comes the muffled roar of great powe generating -- not the sound of earthly motors, but of a  tremendous dynamo.

dialogues.speaker: THE DELEGATES
dialogues.text: watching breathless, stunned by what they have heard and  seen.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHIP
dialogues.text: As the sound from inside it builds to a climax, the great ship takes off with a tremendous roar.

dialogues.speaker: DELEGATES
dialogues.text: All are deeply moved and impressed. In the mind of each i the burning question that Klaatu has posed for them.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHIP
dialogues.text: as it soars away into the inky blackness of the outer spa from which it came.
